channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MN

item.title: Report X-2023090716
item.description:
Report X-2023090716

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE AUDITOR NOTED A STRONG ODOR EMANATING FROM PACKAGE, AND NOTIFIED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA. INSPECTING THE PACKAGE REVEALED THAT ONE OF FOUR INNER CONTAINERS HAD A LOOSE CAP, CAUSING LIQUID TO LEAK ONTO THE CARDBOARD, STAINING IT. CANNOT BE RETURNED IN A SALVAGE DRUM. ALL CONTENTS WERE DISPOSED OF THROUGH THE DMP.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was brought to QA attention and placed on black liquid tray DescribePack: No visible package failure, however, package is significantly lighter than specified weight DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA was quickly notified and package was brought to QA on a black liquid tray

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING PROPER PPE, FOUND LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR OF TRAILER. RESPONDER PLACED SAID PACKAGE INTO SPILL TRAY. CLEANER UP CONTAMINATED AREA. RETURNED TO DMP FOR PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2023081893
item.description:
Report X-2023081893

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-25
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: HAP specialist was doing a dock walk in the unload to check for damages and repacks when he spotted a damaged hazmat sitting on the floor. it is not known exactly when it was set aside, but definitely the same day. He called out to the HESS specialist for a lined tote and placed it in the tote, allowing HESS specialist to bring it back to the damage area and move it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: two bottles leaked very small amounts due to loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023081886

Report X-2023081886

  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: damaged package was called out. QA responded and placed it in a lined tote, performing immediate in-house cleanup. DescribePack: puncture on bottom of jerrican caused product to leak DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats

item.title: Report X-2023081875
item.description:
Report X-2023081875

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: someone placed the package onto its side, ignoring the directional arrows. sometime later someone called out the damaged hazmat at the loading dock door. QA admin responded, only to find that it was improperly oriented, which is why it leaked. he performed in-house cleanup and placed it in a lined tote, then brought it back to the damage area and moved it to the drain mats in the incoming damaged hazmat/LQ area. in-house cleanup, awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one bottle leaked due to the package being placed on its side, instead of obeying the directional arrows. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediate in-house cleanup. placed in lined tote, moved to drain mats
